intro: Onychium fimbriatum, commonly known as the fringed onychium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that consist of numerous small, fimbriate (fringed) flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs. Onychium fimbriatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in cool, moist environments.
